sub_topic: Find the covariant derivative of a tensor field on a manifold.
message_1: Let $M$ be a smooth manifold with $g_{ij}$ being the components of a Riemannian metric tensor field. Consider a vector field $V = V^i \frac{\partial}{\partial x^i}$ on $M$ and a tensor field $T = T^{i_1...i_k}_{j_1...j_l} \frac{\partial}{\partial x^{i_1}} \otimes ... \otimes \frac{\partial}{\partial x^{i_k}} \otimes dx^{j_1} \otimes ... \otimes dx^{j_l}$ of type $(k,l)$. Find the components of the covariant derivative $\nabla_V T$ of $T$ with respect to $V$ on $M$, expressed in terms of $V$, $T$, and the Christoffel symbols $\Gamma^i_{jk}$ of the metric $g_{ij}$.
message_2:
To compute the components of the covariant derivative $\nabla_V T$ of the tensor field $T$ with respect to the vector field $V$, we use the following formula for the covariant derivative of a tensor field of type $(k,l)$:

$$(\nabla_V T)^{i_1...i_k}_{j_1...j_l} = V^m \frac{\partial T^{i_1...i_k}_{j_1...j_l}}{\partial x^m} + \sum_{p=1}^k \Gamma^{i_p}_{mn} V^n T^{i_1...m...i_k}_{j_1...j_l} - \sum_{q=1}^l \Gamma^m_{n j_q} V^n T^{i_1...i_k}_{j_1...m...j_l}.$$

Here, the first term on the right-hand side represents the ordinary derivative of the tensor components with respect to the coordinates, while the second and third terms account for the change in the basis vectors and covectors due to the curvature of the manifold.

In this expression, the Christoffel symbols $\Gamma^i_{jk}$ are determined by the metric tensor $g_{ij}$ and its inverse $g^{ij}$ through the following formula:

$$\Gamma^i_{jk} = \frac{1}{2} g^{il} \left( \frac{\partial g_{lj}}{\partial x^k} + \frac{\partial g_{lk}}{\partial x^j} - \frac{\partial g_{jk}}{\partial x^l} \right).$$

Thus, the components of the covariant derivative $\nabla_V T$ can be computed in terms of the vector field $V$, the tensor field $T$, and the Christoffel symbols $\Gamma^i_{jk}$ associated with the metric $g_{ij}$.
